description.raw:
The `gazebo-install-one_liner-homebrew-amd64` build failed recently. It didn't actually install the package during the install step, then failed during the test step.

* http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install-one_liner-homebrew-amd64/473/

Running `brew audit` helps reveal the cause:

~~~
 ~/osrf/release-tools
$ brew audit gazebo8
osrf/simulation/gazebo8:
  * Dependency 'qt5' was renamed; use new name 'qt'.
  * Dependency 'qt5' is an alias; use the canonical name 'qt'.
  * Dependency 'qt5' was renamed; use new name 'qt'.
  * Dependency 'qt5' is an alias; use the canonical name 'qt'.
~~~

We can fix the problem with a new gazebo bottle. In the meantime, I'd like to add a `brew audit` step to the one-line installer to help provide better debugging information in the future.

  • http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install-one_liner-homebrew-amd64/473/

Running brew audit helps reveal the cause:

$ brew audit gazebo8
osrf/simulation/gazebo8:
  * Dependency 'qt5' was renamed; use new name 'qt'.
  * Dependency 'qt5' is an alias; use the canonical name 'qt'.
  * Dependency 'qt5' was renamed; use new name 'qt'.
  * Dependency 'qt5' is an alias; use the canonical name 'qt'.

We can fix the problem with a new gazebo bottle. In the meantime, I'd like to add a brew audit step to the one-line installer to help provide better debugging information in the future.
